results.title: Faxanadu
results.brief_description: Faxandu is for the Famicom and NES. The name was licensed by Falcom and was developed and released in Japan in 1987. Nintendo also released the game to the world market in 1990. It can be considered a side-story of Xanadu, which is the second installment of Falcom’s long-running RPG series, Dragon Slayer. The title is a combination of “Famicom” and “Xanadu”

constellations_other.name: Silent adventures (Hollow Knight - Education)
constellations_other.description: Videogames, film and TV usually rely on the spoken word to communicate character and story. It wasn’t always this way. Although we may think of ‘silent films’ as in the past, there are contemporary videogames and films that shy away from using the spoken word.

results.description: The player-controlled protagonist of  is an unidentified wanderer. He has no name, though the Japanese version allows the player to choose one. The game begins when he approaches Eolis, his hometown, after an absence to find it in disrepair and virtually abandoned. Worse still, the town is under attack by Dwarves.The Elven king explains that the Elf fountain water, their life source, has stopped and provides the protagonist with 1500 golds, the games currency, to prepare for his journey to uncover the cause.As the story unfolds, it is revealed that Elves and Dwarfs lived in harmony among the World Tree until The Evil One emerged from a fallen meteorite. The Evil One then transformed the Dwarves into monsters against their will and set them against the Elves. The Dwarf King, Grieve, swallowed his magical sword before he was transformed, hiding it in his own body to prevent The Evil One from acquiring it. It is only with this sword that The Evil One can be destroyed.His journey takes him to four overworld areas: The tree’s buttress, the inside of the trunk, the tree’s branches and finally the Dwarves’ mountain stronghold.
description_for_label: The player-controlled protagonist of  is an unidentified wanderer. He has no name, though the Japanese version allows the player to choose one. The game begins when he approaches Eolis, his hometown, after an absence to find it in disrepair and virtually abandoned. Worse still, the town is under attack by Dwarves.The Elven king explains that the Elf fountain water, their life source, has stopped and provides the protagonist with 1500 golds, the games currency, to prepare for his journey to uncover the cause.As the story unfolds, it is revealed that Elves and Dwarfs lived in harmony among the World Tree until The Evil One emerged from a fallen meteorite. The Evil One then transformed the Dwarves into monsters against their will and set them against the Elves. The Dwarf King, Grieve, swallowed his magical sword before he was transformed, hiding it in his own body to prevent The Evil One from acquiring it. It is only with this sword that The Evil One can be destroyed.His journey takes him to four overworld areas: The tree’s buttress, the inside of the trunk, the tree’s branches and finally the Dwarves’ mountain stronghold.

results.title: Fawlty Towers: Basil the Rat
results.brief_description: Manuel insists that his pet rodent is a Siberian hamster. Basil is convinced that the pet shop has conned the gullible Spaniard and sold him a rat - a fine thing to have running around the hotel when the public health inspector is also on the loose.
results.description: Manuel insists that his pet rodent is a Siberian hamster. Basil is convinced that the pet shop has conned the gullible Spaniard and sold him a rat - a fine thing to have running around the hotel when the public health inspector is also on the loose.

results.title: Fawlty Towers. the Kipper and the Corpse. Waldorf Salad,Etc.
results.brief_description: Chaos reigns as one of the guests, with complete disregard for Basil’s blood pressure, dies in his bed. Doubtless it was the kippers, (which should have been thrown out weeks ago), that did it to him. Demented and panic stricken, Basil attempts to conceal both the body and the fishy breakfast. This compilation tape also includes “Waldorf salad” and “A touch of class”.

results.title: Fawlty Towers. The Builders. The Wedding party. The Psychiatrist
results.brief_description: The Builders: There is building work required in the hotel lobby and, when Sybil’s back is turned, Basil immediately goes for the lowest quote for the job, but soon discovers why O’Reilly and his men come so cheap. “The Wedding party”: Basil’s prudish nature is outraged by what he perceives to be an outbreak of promiscuity at Fawlty Towers. As ever, he first grabs the wrong end of the stick and then proceeds to beat himself with it. “The Psychiatrist”: A young yobbo whom Sybil obviously fancies, a voluptuous Australian girl and a psychiatrist provide a hilarious series of misunderstandings and blunders by Basil.

results.title: Fawlty Towers. Hotel inspector. Germans. Touch of class
results.brief_description: The infamous Torquay hotel, “Fawlty Towers”, presided over by the eminently certifiable Basil Fawlty - played by John Cleese - is the setting for the following three hilarious episodes: “The Hotel Inspector”; “The Germans”; and “A Touch of Class”.

results.title: Faust
results.creator_credit: Friedrich W. Murnau, Erich Pommer and UFA
results.brief_description: Classic silent German cinema from the talented F.W.Murnau, 1926. “The portals of darkness are open and the shadows of the dead hunt over the earth..” opens the film with the prevailing theme of good versus evil as the devil Mephisto does a deal with alchemist Faust for his soul and potentially for dominion over the Earth - promising he will stop the plague that is rife throughout Faust’s village. Faust reneges on the arrangement choosing love - much to the delight of Archangel St. Michael. Based on the original story by Goethe. Great cinematography and effects give the film a dark foreboding and general creepiness that add to the dramatic impact of the work. This edition features orchestral soundtrack by the Olympia Chamber Orchestra.

results.title: Fatty Finn
results.creator_credit: Maurice Murphy, Brian Rosen, Finn Films, Australian Film Commission and Children's Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Film version of Australia’s comic strip, set in the years of the depression. Fatty is head of the neighbourhood nice guys and has a final confrontation with Bruiser Murphy and his gang of toughs. Stars Noni Hazlehurst and Bert Newton.

results.title: Fats
results.creator_credit: Michael Coyle and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Home Economics”.
This film stresses the correlation between heart disease and the consumption of fats and oils in the diet. Outlines ways in which the amount of fat and oil in the diet can be reduced.
